intro: Stenanthera pungens, commonly known as the sharp-leaved lily, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, pointed leaves and produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific care to flourish.
